components.description:
A white piece of paper, curled up at the bottom to the left or right, with text printed on it, as a business letter. Commonly used for content concerning various types of documents and writing.

Most platforms indicate text with dark lines. Apple’s design features an easter egg, addressed Dear Katie with text from its 1997–2002 Crazy Ones/Think Different ad campaign:

Here’s to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward…

Samsung’s design is addressed Dear Samsung. Early designs from au by KDDI resemble ðŸ“„ Page Facing Up, suggesting this emoji may have been originally intended to represent documents on a computer.

Not to be confused with ðŸ“„ Page Facing Up or other emojis featuring sheets of paper.
components.title: Page with Curl

title: Page with Curl

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Office symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A printed page, curled at the bottom. The Apple version of this emoji contains the following words: Dear Katie, Hereâ€™s to the crazy ones. Th http://emojipedia.org/page-with-curl/
emoji_net_data.name: page with curl

bn:00086160v: To cause to move in a curve.
Form a curl, curve, or kink

bn:00086162v: To twist or roll into coils, spirals or ringlets.
To twist or form (the hair, etc.) into ringlets.
Twist or roll into coils or ringlets

bn:00085489v: To construct by mental labor; to think up; particularly, to produce or create a literary or musical work.
To write, especially a literary or artistic work; to compose
To produce or create a literary or musical work.
To construct by mental labor; to think up.

bn:00028015n: Writing that provides information (especially information of an official nature)
A document is a written or drawn representation of thoughts.
Written or drawn representation of thoughts

bn:00050802n: A written message addressed to a person or organization
A letter is a written message from one party to another containing information.
A form of written communication; see also mail
A written message; a letter, note or memo.
A text that is written to and for a specific person or set of people (and is most commonly sent to them by post).
An activity that tracks the delivery of a letter. The activity can contain the electronic copy of the letter.
Written message containing information from one party to another

bn:00060158n: In word processing, the text and display elements to be printed on one side of a sheet of paper, subject to formatting specifications such as depth, margin size, and number of columns.
One side of a paper leaf on which one has written or printed.
Where the abbreviation comes from Latin pagina
One side of a leaf of a book.
One side of a leaf of a book or manuscript.
One side of one leaf (of a book or magazine or newspaper or letter etc.) or the written or pictorial matter it contains
One side of a leaf of paper
A page is one side of a leaf of paper.

The new designer tool added to the object designer for the RoleTailored interface of Microsoft Dynamics NAV (RoleTailored client).Â Using the page designer, which is accessed through the object designer, you can create Task Pages, Places, UI Parts and other objects for the new Dynamics NAV UI (RoleTailored client).Â  The new RoleTailored client does not support forms designed in the Form Designer.

bn:00060464n: A material made of cellulose pulp derived mainly from wood or rags or certain grasses
A sheet material used for writing on or printing on (or as a non-waterproof container), usually made by draining cellulose fibres from a suspension in water.
Material mainly used for writing upon, printing upon, drawing or for packaging
Felted or matted sheets of cellulose fibers, formed on a fine-wire screen from a dilute water suspension, and bonded together as the water is removed and the sheet is dried.
Paper is a thin material produced by pressing together moist fibers, typically cellulose pulp derived from wood, rags or grasses, and drying them into flexible sheets.
